summary: This is a discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It lists materials being produced, including video, photos, deposition documents, financial records, travel records, and FBI documents, all subject to a protective order.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a batch of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, including video, photos, depositions, financial records, and travel records.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: 44 Kinnerton Street, London SW1 8ES, United Kingdom
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials including a video, a photo of a London address (44 Kinnerton Street), deposition documents, JPMorgan Chase records, maps, Palm Beach School District records, and travel records for both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The production was governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and the materials were marked to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The document references an ongoing criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (MN)).
The Government notes its discovery obligations are ongoing and that some files were received in an unopenable format but were produced anyway.
The letter is signed by U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss on behalf of the Department of Justice.
